summary: This is an FBI Crisis Intake report documenting a social media tip received on August 15, 2019. The tip, from a Twitter user, referenced a video about Julian Assange and Wikileaks possibly containing Jeffrey Epstein's 'blackbook' and reported online harassment. The FBI's Office of Public Affairs forwarded the comment for assessment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named in the case title for child sex trafficking; the social media tip references a video possibly containing his 'blackbook'.

persons.name: Julian Assange
persons.context: Mentioned in the social media post as the subject of a video that may contain Jeffrey Epstein's blackbook.

persons.name: Kittyhundal
persons.context: Twitter username (kittyhundal) who posted a comment about blocking a user and reporting possible harassment to the FBI. Listed as the complainant.

connections.description: Kittyhundal's social media post referenced a video about Julian Assange that may contain Jeffrey Epstein's blackbook, linking them thematically in the online tip.
Linked thematically in a social media video post, which was reported to the FBI, suggesting the video connected Assange/Wikileaks to Epstein's blackbook.

events.title: Social Media Tip to FBI
events.description: Twitter user 'kittyhundal' posted a comment regarding a video about Julian Assange and Wikileaks possibly containing Jeffrey Epstein's blackbook, and reported online harassment. The FBI Office of Public Affairs forwarded the comment to the National Threat Operations Center.

events.title: FBI Crisis Intake Report Created
events.description: An FBI Crisis Intake report was drafted to document the social media tip received the previous day concerning Jeffrey Epstein and potential online harassment.

keyFacts: The FBI received a social media tip on August 15, 2019, linking a video about Julian Assange and Wikileaks to Jeffrey Epstein's alleged 'blackbook'.

The tip also included a complaint about online harassment, with the user ('kittyhundal') claiming someone was 'tormenting his mother publically' and questioning if it was a hack or a Twitter employee.
The document is a routine FBI intake form for assessing potential threats from social media, showing the bureau was monitoring online chatter about Epstein shortly after his 2019 arrest.
The case is formally titled under Jeffrey Epstein for child sex trafficking (Case ID: 31E-NY-3027571).
